newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: U.S. plunge pull Australia stocks two pct lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. plunge pull Australia stocks two pct lower.

text.p: The Australian share market recovered some of Monday's initial losses triggered by Wall Street's 3.1 percent plummet on Friday, but shares were still two percent weaker by midday.

By 12.15 p.m. (0215 GMT), the All Ordinaries index was 54.9 points lower at 2,611.3, while September share price index futures were 60 points weaker at 2,602, a 9.3 point discount to the underlying index. Turnover amounted to A$410 million.
"It was inevitable that we were going to have a fall, but it has recovered quite a bit and it seems to be improving all the time," said Kevin Lourey of Peake Lands Kirwan.
